channel.title: SetConst function?

item.title: SetConst function?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

That would defeat the purpose of it. I’m not sure if you know this, but constant means that it doesn’t change, in other words, the water was kept at a constant temperature, 15 degrees, and variable means the opposite, able to change, the water was kept at 15 degrees but was variable in the temperature.

Read full topic

item.title: SetConst function?

item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

a Const is a -Constant- value, It cannot change in SCAR.
It could be done but if you need to store a value that changes use a variable

item.title: SetConst function?
item.dc:creator: @IP-Drowner IP-Drowner
item.description:
@IP-Drowner wrote:

Could you possibly add a function called SetConst.

How to use it?
function SetConst(ConstName([/i]Constant Value[/i]));

Not sure if there is any around, but i think it would be useful.

F.A.Q
What is the purpose of this function?
The purpose is for the SCAR script to change an existing constant’s value.

Why do i want to add it?
Because i am not very familiar to forms and use constants most of the time instead of forms and i would like to change some constants e.g True of False questions.

How do i actually use this constant?
Here is an example SCAR script:[code]
const
StartedScript = False;
AntiBan = True;

var
x, y: Integer;

procedure StartScript;
begin
SetConst(StartedScript(True));
if(FindColor(x,y,255,0,0,1024,768)) then;
begin
repeat
if(FindColor(x,y,255,0,0,1024,768)) then;
begin
MoveMouse(x,y);
Wait(100)
ClickMouse(x,y,True);
end;
MoveMouse(x,y);
Wait(100)
ClickMouse(x,y,True);
Until(IsFKeyDown(3));
end;
end;

begin
StartScript;
end.[/code]

Or you could use it to reset a Username value e.g.:[code]
const
Username = ‘Zezima’;
Password = ‘Zezima’;

procedure ResetUser;
begin
SetConst(Username(‘MoparIsTheBest’));
begin
repeat
MoveMouse(400,400);
Wait(100)
Until(IsFKeyDown(3))
end;
end;

begin
ResetUser;
end.[/code]

I hope you accept this function for a later version of SCAR!

Read full topic
